data.title: Needs updated!
data.text: El Gordo's used to be our go to spot for reasonable food prices and good margaritas.  One previous reviewer stated the place needs a makeover and I completely agree.  Although they scaled back their hours, it would still be a good idea to for the restaurant to do a thorough cleaning and sprucing up. Nonetheless, we had very good, attentive service and there was plenty of food.  The margaritas are good and reasonably priced.

data.title: A make over is in order.
data.text: El Gordo's is an old restaurant that needs an update badly.  Our waitress was friendly and helpful.  Food was not the best I have eaten and most likely will not return.  The restaurant was clean but had the odor of an old, old building.  The front staff could be more friendly.

data.title: good ole enchiladas
data.text: Just what I was craving. Everything was just right, Service, atmosphere. price, portion, and taste were all good,

data.title: Bad service and bad food
data.text: We got a gift card for this restaurant, so we went to check it out; the only thing Mexican was the name.  To begin with, we were not addressed by the first waiter.  The meat they used for the tacos and for burritos looked like the same meat Taco Bell uses.  I will never ever go back to this restaurant.

data.title: Horrible food and service, don't  recomended at all
data.text: Server not even apologize for the inconvenience with the food. Simply not worth it. They bring me the same plate twice and i have the same issue

data.title: If you give a mouse mexican food
data.text: On two separate times we at this restaurant and we had a mouse run across our feet.  I made a promise to myself never to eat there again.

data.title: Good food consistently
data.text: Good food and good prices. IT has always been consistently good and stays the same regardless of the time of day.

data.title: Great service
data.text: Great wait staff,  can't ever go wrong with the carne asada.  The place has been around forever and could use some cleaning but the food really is quite good.

data.title: Taco Bell is better then this
data.text: I ordered Flautas which ended up being 4 rolled tortillas with nothing inside deep fried in grease until chewy and charged 8 dollars . absolutely nothing was fresh and seriously french fries with Tacos?  at a Mexican restaurant. This restaurant needs to be on one of those Food Network Shows how bad it is. Keep driving you'all.

data.title: Good Overall Experience
data.text: Was a little worried with the mixed reviews but we were pleased overall. The service was excellent and we were able to make a few changes to our selections. I ordered the buritto and it looked bland so I asked them to add some chili sauce and cheese on top. They took it back and voila, excellent buritto. I suggested they sell it like this from now often and they said they would definitely think about it. Overall, I would return when back in town.

data.title: Inconsistant ...
data.text:
As you enter the Resturant, the different paint colors on the walls might take your breath away... its dark, and can seem somewhat dingy ... so if your looking for ambiance, this is perhaps not the place for you...  

As local Dives go... this one isnt horrible... but, As a regular customer ... I have to say that El Gordo's is inconsistant... 

On one visit, you will have wonderful service and food is ok, on another visit you could have service that is somewhat awkward and uncomfortable...but the food is delicious!  Then the third time, you could have Amazing Service and Amazing food... 

Coming from Southern California mexican food, Tex Mex is OK.. but some are much better than others... El Gordo's over all has decent food... 

My recommendations:  

Large Guac minus the lettuce with limes on the side

The Jalisco minus the sweet tomato based sauce ...and I high recommend sour cream on the side for the heat factor... 

The Enchilada special is very good ... and Chimichanga's are outstanding! 

Items I would steer clear of would be the Chile Relleno and the Taco Salad...although the Chicken Taco Salad is very good!  

But! The absolute best thing about El Gordo's is the PRICE .... If you want some cheap eats... you have found your place!  And for the food that is good...it is more than worth the price!

data.title: Keep driving
data.text: Not good. The food was terrible  Service was great.

data.title: Authentic Mexican
data.text: Graet service, and great value! 10 of us went for lunch and they were extremnely accomodating as we had a tight timeline. I am not an afficianado of "authentic" mexican food but my colleagues swore by it's authenticity!

data.title: Nasty food & rude manager...NO THANKS!!!
data.text: We drove to Wichita Falls from Ft. Worth just for a mini vaca.  Fri evening we were craving mexican food, and this place was just down the street from out hotel, so thought we'd give it a shot. First thing we noticed was how cheap their food was. We soon realized why.  As one review mentioned above, the queso tasted like cheez whiz in a jar. My husband's relleno looked like a log of ????, and tasted like it had been fried in fish grease. I seriously thought he was going to puke at the table. My middle son had bean nachos, and the beans tasted and looked old. My chicken quesadillas were mediocre; had better, but were edible. I tasted my rice, and it was like cardboard;my oldest son took about 3 bites of his dinner, and my youngest took 1 bite of his chicken nugget. When I tasted of it, I could not associate the taste with chicken at all.  We asked for refills; the kids got theirs, but my tea glass was ignored. At that time, we spoke to the manager. She denied they fry their fish, and swore the grease is changed every Wed. She simply said she would take care of it and walked off. As we went to pay for the food we did eat, the drinks and margarita, she so rudely popped off and said "Don;t worry about it, but don't ever come back."  LADY>>>we wanted to pay for what we ate, and make you aware of what's going on in your restaurant. She didn't want to know; maybe she already knew; either way, take care your business or your business will fail. We decided on McD's for dinner. But Sat. we went to Casa Manana for lunch....I got 1 word for y'all....YUMMY!!!!!!

data.title: Delish hole in the wall!
data.text: We ate at El Gordo's for lunch. It was very dark inside but I had probably the best Taco Salad I've ever eaten! The shell was yummy and the taco meat was wonderful!

data.title: Nasty.....seriously keep driving.
data.text: Nasty.....seriously keep driving.

data.title: Food....what food?
data.text:
We had theater tickets for 8:00 and chose El Gordo because it is just blocks away from the theater. We arrived at 6:45, and the place was about 3/4 full. We were the only ones at the door, and the sign says to wait to be seated. The hostess was on the phone, put it down, went to get a menu, and came back and read items and prices to the caller, then took a to-go order, all while we stood waiting to be seated! 

Finally got to a table, and waited about 5 more minutes to get menus, and maybe 5 to 8 more to have a chance to order. We ordered at 7:15, a full 30 minutes after arriving and being the ONLY people at the door. We still had plenty of time, though, or so we thought.
We got chips and salsa....and waited....and waited....and waited.....and then waited some more......finally at 7:50 we got up and left, no food, no service, nothing at all......

One hour and 5 minutes for a basket of chips and a bowl of salsa.....when we left, we looked for someone to pay for the chips, but there was nobody at the cash register either....waited for 5 minutes looking for someone to pay for the chips...and finally walked out the door in order to make the theater curtain at 8:00......

Worst place we have ever been to in Wichita Falls....

data.title: Good Food...Good Service
data.text:
I have to admit it doesn't look like much from the outside but there were a lot of cars around it.  I have to admit it looks cave like inside.  But the people eating lunch inside looked prosperous.

Now I don't  my tamales from guacamole.  To me Mexican food always looks like the guy who ate it first didn't enjoy it.  But I found the food really tasty and as one person said the chips and salsa addictive.  It was really good.

The service was fast and for a little over $5 plus drink I was on the road again.

data.title: The worst restaurant I have ever experienced!
data.text: I wanted to treat my grandparents to a nice dinner for their 60th anniversay instead we found this place. It started the minute we walked through the door. Everything from the floors to the furniture screamed wore out and out dated, but I wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt after all some of the best mexican restaurants have been little hole in the wall places. We first ordered some caso dip and I think all they did was open a jar of cheese whiz and pour it in a bowl. We ordered enchilada dinners, and my daughter had ordered hers without onions and instead she got onion and cheese whiz filled enchiladas. Everyone's enchiladas had hard pieces on them and the beans were dried out, it looked like they had left them out for days. The only real thing worth eating was the rice. When I went to pay for the meals they asked if everything was okay so I told them no. I tried to tell her what was wrong and she just got very defensive and RUDE. She acted as if I had insulted her personally. I was spending almost $100 with them and simply asked for a small discount since our meal was not very good. She told me she would NOT give me a discount because I had ordered this food and it came from their kitchen. What it mattered that it came fom the kitchen I don't know. I couldn't believe how rude she was, it blew my mind. The worst customer service I have every recieved! I will never return to this restaurant.

data.title: Welcome Surprise
data.text:
I was very much ready to hate this place.  

I had just been driving around looking for the restaurant I had intended to eat at (Casa Manana) when I finally decided to call and get directions.  I got their voicemail -- they close every night at 7:30 p.m.  Que?

So, it was 7:45 on a Monday night, and the only thing moving in downtown Wichita Falls was the occasional plastic sack blowing across the road.  El Gordo's was lit up, and I pulled into their parking lot.

Now, you should understand I've spent a respectable chunk of my life in Texas, but a few years ago I moved to Washington, D.C., where decent Tex-Mex is more rare than an honest lobbyist.  I always found this inexplicable, because -- face it -- we ain't talkin' haute cuisine here.  Anyway, if you spend any time in Texas, you pretty much become a Tex-Mex snob by default, and I'm guilty as charged.

When I walked up to El Gordo's I started having my doubts.  Could've been the hours pasted on (and peeling away from) the doorway with stick-on mailbox numbers or the very faded and somewhat creepy floral casino-style carpeting (the kind specifically designed to hide all manner of spills and other accidents).  Perhaps it was the sight of the booths with a goodly portion of the paint scraped off or maybe the voice in the back of my head saying "Leave.  Now." after my initial perusal of the menu found that on Mondays one can order the "cheese enchilada special" for $3.25.

But I was there, so I stayed and ordered one of the most expensive items on the menu -- chicken fajitas for just under $10 -- and a margarita.  The chips and salsa arrived without additional cost associated (D.C. restaurants would do well to note this is normal ... and expected).  The salsa was of the tomato-saucey variety -- not immediately thrilling, but pretty addictive.  Eventually, I had to push it away lest I consume the entire basket of chips.  The margarita initially struck me as something that might double as snow-cone syrup due to the sweetness.

Yep.  Definitely ready to hate the place.

Then the fajitas showed up on a skillet that was one-half refried beans.  Good refried beans.  Really good.  (The entire city of Washington, D.C., can't figure out how to make refried beans, much less decent ones).  The chicken had a great char-grilled flavor with distinct grill marks and was fantastically moist.  The tortillas were steaming hot and the guacamole was the basic pure chunky and super fresh variety that made the dish famous in the first place.  Nothing experimental, weird or slimy, just great guacamole made the way it's supposed to be.  I also got about a tablespoon of spicy pico de gallo in a little plastic container (tasty, but I could've used a lot more of it). 

The fajitas imparted that warm, homey and overstuffed feeling you expect to get from a Mexican restaurant.  And by the end of the meal?  Well, that margarita was tasting pretty good.

Then the waitress brought the bill.  Turns out that margaritas are a buck a piece on certain days during certain hours, she tells me.  So, my whole meal, including tax, was $11.01.

Given the fact my last margarita in D.C. was $16, any grousing about the El Gordo's $1 margarita shall cease now and forever more.

I saw they had chile rellenos and tamales on the menu.  I'll have to try them next time ... because I'm going back.
